intro: Mammillaria spinosissima var. castaneoides, commonly known as the red spiny mammillaria, is a compact cactus native to Mexico. It features short, cylindrical stems covered in white to pale green areoles, from which spines and flowers emerge. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its spines are typically reddish-brown and can be quite密集, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
